content:
Regardless of what the email provider may be adding to the headers, I don't want Thunderbird to do anything; just leave all arriving messages in the Inbox. I picked one of the "junked" messages and posted the headers into my mail service provider's checker, and it said there was nothing wrong with it; so I don't think the service provider is doing this.

content:
I'm not sure what you are wanting to achieve but if you are after the Cards View rather than Table click the icon I've highlighted below.

Other things could be being held by your settings or extensions. To find out restart in Troubleshoot Mode. To do that press Alt-h and then Troubleshoot Mode on the drop-down menu that appears. That will temporarily disable extensions and most of your personal settings. If you then get what you want you can start fiddling about.

content:
Globálna databáza je indexovací systém umožňujúcí Thunderbirdu vyhľadávať v zprávach. Znovuvytvorenie globálnej databázy preindexuje správy a vizitky z adresára. (Správy z konferencií nie sú indexované.)

Postup znovuvytvorenia globálnej databázy: - Ukončite Thunderbird. - Vyhľadajte vo svojom profile Thunderbirdu súbor global-messages-db.sqlite - Vymažte tento súbor. - Spustite Thunderbird. Automaticky sa začne proces vytvárania indexu. V závislosti na počte správ môže indexácia trvať dosť dlhý čas (cca 5 minút). Počas indexácie môžete Thunderbird používat, iba bude znížený jeho výkon a vyhľadávania prinesú iba čiastočné výsledky, alebo dokonca žiadne. Proces indexácie môžete sledovať v Správcovi aktivít (ponuka Nástroje > Správca činnosti).

content: That letter is important for some microsoft users as some email clients (NOT Thunderbird) didn't support Oauth2 at the time of the announcement and are working to correct that. There is no change for Thunderbird, as TB is already designed to support the new MS direction - which is basically to use their servers (outlook.office365.com and smtp.office365.com and use Oauth2. If you have that setting, you're good.

It's free, although a small donation gets a registration code. Try it and I think you will agree.

The error indicates you're trying to send from the rr.com account through the gmail smtp. The rr.com account should send through mail.twc.com, 587, STARTTLS. Check that your accounts are aligned with the correct smtp servers.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593

content: I just imported a message folder from a Local Folders in Postbox and it worked fine. I did it two ways, once with importexporttools import mbox option and once by oopying with windows file explorer. Might the message folders you're copying be IMAP account? Admittedly, I used a more recent version of Postbox, but I doubt that would be a concern.
creator: davidsk

content:
They're not IMAP, just local folders where emails from POP accounts where automatically moved into with filter rules.

With Importexporttools, do you mean some add-on to Thunderbird, or the standard included Import tool in the Tools menu?
creator: Pete393

content: yes, the addon importexporttools
creator: davidsk

content:
Which one do you mean? I can only find this one calles "ImportExportTools NG":

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/search/?q=importexporttools&appver=128.1.0&platform=WINNT

It only offers "Import Profile" menu option which imports the entire profile. There is no mbox import option.

When I import the entire Postbox profile, it imports all the (local) folders and messages headers, but now all emails contain hexadecimal gibberish.
creator: Pete393

content: My earlier instructions were obviously vague. I stated i was at Local Folders. Highlight Local Folders, rightclick and there is an import mbox option.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks. This way it imported the message contents as well. However, HTML formatting and all images and attachments are missing.
creator: Pete393

content: I suggest checking your settings in View>message body as to see if you're set for plain text. HTML, if present, is tightly embedded into the message. But you at least have the content. I'm glad for that.
creator: davidsk

content:
Wow, it works!

After setting "Message body as" (under More button) to "Original HTML" it works (and this applies to all emails). I had no idea it was showing plain text by default for imported emails (all new incoming emails did show in HTML by default).

Thanks a lot for your help.
creator: Pete393

content: You are very welcome.

content:
I have this issue as well. It is exactly as reported by user dariny in thread https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1459658#answer-1669667.

"Have the same problem. Working fine Saturday then nothing Sunday and since then. Thunderbird asks for password with a pop up. After flickering through several URLs (Yahoo and GoogleAnalytics among them) final URL on login page is for tsdtocl.com which seems suspect. Same problem has occurred for a couple of posters on Reddit.

I've run several AV checks on my system to see if maybe something had slipped through that changed things but nothing comes up. I've hunted the internet trying to find something similar and the solution but no luck.

If you find out anything else, please post. :-)"

dariny includes a screen shot of the alleged Yahoo login page.
creator: chaines401

content:
Good eye Carl & Dariny. I checked online using a virus scanner website & 2 AVs flagged that site as malicious & suspicious: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/url/3f9a02dc6e9f80a5479d345245c786cfc7160f713e4003b7102d8bf120a6edb7

Some other reports: https://any.run/report/e85cb9074de12e.../55ae0367-bdbc-49a2-b081-9c360243b0d4 https://www.scam-detector.com/validator/tsdtocl-com-review/

Sometimes its a false positive and could be harmless. But you may want to run some malware scans using Malwarebytes, Hitman Pro and others just to be sure.
